decision_conditions: The proposed fascia signs, by reason of their design and means of illumination, would be detrimental to the architectural composition of the original property, and character, appearance and visual amenities of the street scene and would fail to either preserve or enhance the character or appearance of the surrounding Eastcote, Morford Way Conservation Area. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies BE1 and HE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1, DMHB 4 and DMHB 13A of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two - Development Management Policies (March 2019) Policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2016) and the NPPF.

The decision to REFUSE advertisement consent has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).
Insufficient and inconsistent information has been submitted as part of this application. Please ensure accurate and sufficient information is submitted in any resubmission.
description: Installation of 2 internally illuminated fascia signs
